Obama was said to advocate a minimum wage rate that's pegged to a cost of living index; but he didn't strive for it.
 
 He said that a single payer government option for health care insurance would be best for our nation. Then he said that the advantages of such a method may be achieved in some other manner; but he never again mentioned it or any other method.
 
 He has said that we should close Guantanamo prison and eliminate don't ask/don't tell; after two years in office that hasn't been done.
 
 He has said that we cannot afford the additional tax cuts for individuals with annual incomes exceeding a quarter of a million dollars. When the Democratic Party decided to delay the tax debate until after the election, I decided to refrain from voting for Democrats until the tax bill reached the floors of both congressional houses. I voted for the Green Party's congressional candidate in 2010.
 
 I fully expect Obama to cave in a grant some additional "temporary" tax cuts for millionaires. I will not vote for Democrats until they find and retain some courage.
 
 It doesn't appear that I'll be voting for Obama in 2012.
 
 Respectfully, Supposn

 Xcaliber, Nancy Pelosi, (currently speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives) will remain the House Democratic leader. She generally holds her ground.
 
 President Obama and Senator Harry Reid, (the current majority leader of the U.S. Senate have consistently demonstrated and I believe they will continue to demonstrate their lack of courage.
 
 The President will not use his influence and Harry Reid in particular will not force a vote upon the extension of unemployment insurance benefits before any tax vote. The Senate will agree to the additional tax cuts for those earning in excess of a quarter million dollars per year. The only question is if those tax cuts will be permanent or temporary (until the Republicans can make them permanent). If we wanted to induce stimulate our economy, the U.S. Congress could vote to grant a temporary waiver of FICA taxes. 
 
 [All wage and salary earners pay 7.65% of their gross for FICA. Additionally employers' 7.65% of payroll contributions for FICA are passed on similar to a sales tax that's paid by all purchasers of USA goods and services. Unlike a sales tax the FICA tax based upon payroll inhibits job creation and reduces USA's both jobs and median wage.
 Refer to the discussion "FICA's the most regressive federal tax" within the tax debate board].
 
 Respectfully, Supposn

I have a neighbor who has been Unemployed for about 8 months now, when they announced the Extension of Unemployment he literally danced in his yard screaming that he now had more " Vacation".  Electionsign, if you ain't done it, I have little confidence in your opinion of what's required to succeed as a community organizer.
 
 There's a great deal of difference between having a job title and actually performing a job well. I honestly believe that many individual school teachers performed great public services and some of our presidents left a great deal to be desired.
 
 I suppose community organizing is a difficult job and extremely few people could succeed at it. An organizer doesn't have the power, budget or prestige of some high political offices. The lack of power is one of the major reasons it's so difficult for community organizers to achieve success.
 
 Our nation would benefit more from superior community organizers rather than from mediocre or poor presidents.
 
 It's been said that "a nation that has more regard for inferior poets rather than superior plumbers becomes a nation with inferior plumbing and inferior poetry". Maybe among our nation's major handicaps is our lack of respect for people that perform their jobs well. In our society respect is measured in dollars.
 
 Respectfully, Supposn

post_info.post_title: I don't think he lacks courage

Supposn

PottersvilleUSA, I've never had reason to doubt any USA presidents' patriotism. Unfortunately it's convenient too rationalize policies that are to our own or supporters' best interests are also to that of the nation's best interests. I too often have good reason to doubt their judgment.
 
 I'm confident that the policies Obama supported would have been to our nation's best interests. His lack of commitment to his own opinions does himself, the Democratic Party and our nation a great disservice.
 
 In 2008 I decided to cease voting for those I'm less opposed to. If I have no opportunity to vote in favor of something positive, I will decline to cast any vote.
 
 In 2009 the minimum wage rate was increased but Obama made no serious attempt to either to have it annually cost of living adjusted, (COLA'd) or to use such a proposal as a "political chip" to gain a greater 2008 increase of the minimum rate. (I do note that I never found a quote promoting a COLA'd minimum wage rate that was directly attributed to Obama himself; I was so desperate to vote find something worthy of a vote).
 
 He had not yet drawn a firm line and fought for his "government option" but I gave him the benefit of the doubt. I again voted for Democratic candidates in 2010. In 2011 Obama acquiesced and surrendered to his opposition. Failure is an acceptable option; little of significant value has ever been achieved without suffering earlier failures. Obama did not "lose the government option", he failed to stand and fight for it. (I agree that we cannot completely dismiss his 2,000 page healthcare act of undetermined quality). 
 
 The Democratic Party declined to bring income taxes onto the floors of the U.S. Congress prior to the 2010 elections; In 2010 I declined to vote for Democrats. Last year I cast my vote for the Green Party's congressional candidate.
 
 I believe Obama correctly stated we cannot afford to extend the tax reductions for those of our 2% highest taxable incomes but he undermined his own position by not urging congressional Democrats to confront the issue prior to the 2010 elections. Obama has acted contrary to both our nation's short and long term economic interests. Due to his acquiescing and surrendering, USA's federal and individual states' budget deficits will be greater and our economic recovery will be slower.
 
 I will no longer vote for Democrats until they regain and retain some courage and integrity. Obama is the titular leader of the Party. It appears that I will not be voting for Democrats in 2012.
 
 Respectfully, Supposn
